snippet: Until we figure out the true costs of delivering health care to patients, we can’t make the system more efficient.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Profs Robert S Kaplan and Michael E Porter, prompted by the realization that rising health care costs are busting budgets of the federal, state and local governments, offers suggestions for consolidating certain services to improve utilization and reduce some existing capacity; contends such changes will provide a path to combating increasing costs.

byline.original: By ROBERT S. KAPLAN and MICHAEL E. PORTER

lead_paragraph: Until we figure out the true costs of delivering health care to patients, we can’t make the system more efficient.
